title: Jess of All Trades
text:
Jessica is a fifth-year UBC student graduating with a Bachelor of Science in Behavioural Neuroscience and a Minor in Data Science. Her academic interests span the fields of healthcare, neuroscience, and psychology.
Jessica was born and raised up in Victoria, BC - Canada‚Äôs garden city.
I am a Clinical Research Assistant at BC Children‚Äôs Hospital, focusing on pediatric pain management and neurophysiological outcomes. My background includes research in anesthesia, neuroscience, and patient-reported outcomes.

title: üë©üèª‚Äçüéì RESEARCH EXPERIENCE
text: üìÑ View a PDF of Jessica Luo‚Äôs CV

title: Research
text:
May 2023 ‚Äì August 2024
Pediatric Anesthesia Research Team, BC Children‚Äôs Hospital, Vancouver, BC

Recruited patients and their families in person by explaining studies and obtaining informed consent Adhered to protocols and procedures in operating rooms and anesthetic care units, ensuring research data was collected properly, and thinking critically if protocol deviations arise
Performed chart reviews of paper and electronic medical health records (Cerner PowerChart, CST Cerner)
Interpreted and analyzed quantitative data using R; qualitative data using NVivo
Conducted semi-structured interviews for research purposes using Zoom
Supported various projects (clinical drug trials, longitudinal survey studies, quality improvement) from initial to final stages (study conception; research ethics applications; REDCap project set-up; analysis using R, NVivo, and Excel; manuscript writing/preparation/submission)




November 2022 ‚Äì March 2023
UBC Perinatal Anxiety Research Lab, Vancouver, BC

Recruited potential research participants online, through social media and email, by informing them about study parameters and procedures
Ensured participant questions were answered while following TCPS 2 protocols and guidelines
Built relationships with organizations and tracked external partnerships by maintaining documentation of recruitment history through excel




October 2021 ‚Äì March 2022
UBC Murphy Lab/Dynamic Circuits for Brain Health, Vancouver, BC

Conducted online literature reviews on rodent neuroscience research
Supported data collection of rodent subjects and analysis using Python, Raspberry Pi and MATLAB
Created a research project with four other team members and presented the poster at the Multidisciplinary Undergraduate Research Conference

title: EXPERIENCE

title: Hello, it‚Äôs very nice to meet you!
text:
Hello, I‚Äôm Jessica Luo and I am currently a student at the University of British Columbia, majoring in Behavioural Neuroscience major and minoring in Data Science.
My research focuses on pediatric anesthesia, pain management, and neurophysiological monitoring.
